loans.name: Maria Yanira

texts.es: María es una señora muy alegre y llena de deseos de salir adelante, su familia está conformada por su esposo quien trabaja comprando y vendiendo chatarra, así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad. María trabaja elaborando pupusas todos los días, incrementando su clientela los fines de semana que es cuando las personas más consumen estos alimentos. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar: maíz frijoles, queso, chicharrón y otros productos más para elaborar más pupusas y así de esta manera aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es primordial para ella.
texts.en: Maria is a very cheerful lady and is full of desire to get ahead.  Her family is made up of her husband, who works buying and selling scrap metal, and her two children who are minors.  Maria works every day making pupusas [stuffed corn cakes], increasing her clientele on the weekends which is when people consume more of this type of food.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy corn, beans, cheese, pork rinds and other products to make more pupusas and, thus, increase her sales, which is essential for her.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to make pupusas.

loans.name: Maria Maura

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad, vive junto a su hija y un nieto con quienes luchan día con día por salir adelante. María se dedica a elaborar platillos típicos como: enchiladas, tamales, empanadas, pastelitos de carne, yuca frita entre otros más. La venta la realiza en su casa mientras esta elaborando los bocadillos y también los comercializa de forma ambulante en diferentes zonas de la colonia que reside, su nieto le ayuda a realizar esta actividad lo que les permite abarcar más terreno. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL,  con el deseo de contar con el dinero para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: verduras, maíz, aceite y otros más y de esta forma aumentar su venta lo cual sea de mucho beneficio para ella y su familia.
texts.en: María is 44 years old and lives with her daughter and a grandson with whom she struggles every day in order to get ahead.  Maria works making typical dishes like enchiladas, tamales, empanadas, meat pies, fried yuca and other items.  She sells these meals out of her home while she is making sandwiches and she also sells items as a walking salesperson in different zones of her neighborhood where she lives.  Her grandson helps her with this work which permits them to cover more territory.  Maria is asking for a loan from Kiva partner INTEGRAL, with the desire of counting on the money to buy a larger quantity of raw materials like vegetables, corn, oil, and other items.  In this way she will increase her sales which will be very beneficial for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and oil.

loans.name: Roxana Beatriz

texts.es: Roxana Beatriz de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Luis, su hija y su abuela, ella se dedica a la venta  de verduras, pescado, pollo entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia en el mercado de la localidad y de forma ambulante ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Roxana es una mujer emprendedora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito que tanto desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar verduras, pescado, pollo etc. Roxana Beatriz tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Roxana Beatriz is 24 years old and lives together with her life partner Luis, her daughter, and her grandmother.  She works selling vegetables, fish, and chicken, among other items.  She has been working in this field for several years and this has granted her lots of experience in sales which permits her to obtain better income.  She sells in the market of her town, as a walking salesperson, since she has lots of regular customers who prefer her because everything she sells is of high quality at accessible prices, but above all they prefer her for her excellent service.  Roxana is an entrepreneurial woman, with a great desire to get ahead.  She is always looking for new opportunities that will permit her to achieve the success that she so greatly desires.  Like all good business people, she wants to grow her business and to make a new investment, but in order to do that she needs capital which will support her.  For this reason she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy vegetables, fish, chicken, etc.  Roxana Beatriz has good credit references and is very responsible.  She assures us that she will pay back the debt and at the same time she is confident that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fish and chicken.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana Gladys de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad que se dedican a estudiar. Ana trabaja muy duro comercializando prendas de vestir como: ropa interior para hombres, mujeres y niños, calzonetas, camisetas, shorts y otros más, las vende de forma ambulante por diferentes zonas del país. Ella es una mujer muy esforzada quien vela día y noche por el bien de sus hijos, por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de ropa en diversidad de colores y estampados y de esta forma vender más, abarcando todos los gustos de sus clientes y también cautivar a otros nuevos.
texts.en: Ana Gladys, 30, is a single mother who lives with her four children, all of whom are minors and are in school.  Ana works very hard selling articles of clothing such as underwear for men, women and children, t-shirts, shorts and more.  She sells them traveling through different parts of the country.  She is a very hard-working woman who keeps watch day and night for the sake of her children.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy a larger quantity of clothing in diverse colors and patterns to be able to sell more by appealing to the tastes of her customers and also attracting new ones.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Noemy

texts.es: Silvia de 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos menores de edad, por quienes trabajan muy duro para darles todo lo que necesitan. Silvia trabaja como agricultora sembrando maíz y frijoles en su propia parcela, un negocio muy estable que en sus temporadas altas le deja muy buenas ganancias, a pesar de esto la venta de granos básicos no se realiza durante todo el año por lo que deben ahorrar para poder sobrevivir, lo que no les permite hacer arreglos necesarios a su hogar. Silvia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar lámina, cemento, pintura y otros materiales de construcción y así contar con una casa en buenas condiciones para enfrentar el invierno y las duras tormentas.
texts.en:
Silvia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four minor children, for who they work very hard to give them everything they need. Silvia works as a farmer planting corn and beans in her own plot. It's a very stable business and during peak seasons it leaves very good profits, although the sale of basic grains it's not done all year round, so they have to save to survive and it doesn't allow them to make the necessary arrangements in their home.

Silvia is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL through which she will have enough money to buy sheets, cement, paint, and other construction materials and thus have a house in good shape to face the winter and the harsh storms.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Coronada

texts.es: María Coronada de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy concurrido de personas y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y  con un excelente servicio; María es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. María Coronada tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Maria Coronada is forty-two years old.  She lives together with her life partner and her three children.  She earns a living buying and selling fruit and vegetables such as strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, and chilies, among others.  She has been in this business for several years and that has given her a lot of experience which allows her to obtain the best profits.  The place where she conducts business is very busy with people and she already has a lot of customers that prefer her because she offers fresh, quality products at a good price and with excellent service.  

Maria is an entrepreneurial woman.  She is dedicated to her work and has a desire to get ahead.  She is always looking for alternatives that will allow her to be successful.  En the last few weeks, the demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of that in order to make a new investment, but she does not have sufficient capital.  So she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.  Maria Coronada has good payment references and she ensures that she will be able to repay the debt.  At the same time she is confident that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Djénébou

texts.fr:
Madame Djénébou est une femme veuve de 53 ans et mère de 9 enfants qui vit avec ses enfants dans la concession de son feu époux, à Bougouni, dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
C’est à la suite du décès de son conjoint, que Djénébou intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus. Elle tenta plusieurs activités notamment la vente d’habits, de chaussures, de condiments, mais sans succès. Alors elle décida d’apprendre les activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers de boutique, auprès de son frère.
Avec 10 année d’expérience, elle maîtrise cette activité. Ayant fait la connaissance Soro Yiriwaso à travers un agent de l’institution, elle décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elle est à son quatrième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les trois prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. Elle n’a jamais accusé un retard dans ses remboursements.
Djénébou compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs du sucre, 8 cartons de thé, 6 cartons de différentes marques de cigarettes, 5 cartons de savons et 1 carton de biscuits pour sa boutique.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali), auprès des grossistes.
Sa clientèle est mixte. Avec ce prêt, madame Djénébou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage toujours agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Madame Djénébou is a 53 year old widow and the mother of nine children.  She lives with her children on the land owned by her late husband, in Bougouni, in the North Heremakono district.
After the death of her husband Djénébou became interested in earning money.  She tried several types of work such as selling clothing, shoes, and condiments, but without much success.  Then she decided to learn about buying and selling boutique articles from her brother. 
With 10 years of experience she has become an expert in this type of work.  Having learned about Soro Yiriwaso through one of its agents, she decided to become involved with the credit program through Soro Yiriwaso.
She is on her fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso and the previous three loans have been fully repaid.   She was never late with a payment.
Djénébou plans to use her loan to buy five bags of sugar, eight boxes of tea, six boxes of different types of cigarettes, five boxes of soap, and one case of cookies for her boutique. 
She gets her supplies in Bougouni and sometimes in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali), from wholesalers.  
Her clientele is mixed. With this loan, Mrs. Djénébou plans to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA.
With this loan she plans to expand her boutique.

loans.use: to buy various articles for her boutique.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Sok Chan

texts.en: Sok Chan is 59 years old. She is widowed and resides with a daughter in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling rice, charcoal and gas for more than a year, earning approximately $5 daily. Her daughter is employed in a restaurant and earns about $4 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sok Chan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more rice and charcoal to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house if possible

loans.use: to purchase more rice and charcaol to resell

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu works every day sewing, creating new styles for others by request, and offering clients fast and beautiful sewing. She used her previous loan to add a stock of clothes to her clothes-selling business. She already had this business, which she has run for three years now. It is through funding that she has obtained the best sales, as she has bought assorted clothes in order to sell. This has helped toward the household expenses. With this new loan, she will buy fabric, threads, and one sewing machine in order to increase production in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Argelia

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora quien vive junto a sus tres hijos, su compañero de vida se encuentra en los Estados Unidos y quien le brinda la ayuda necesaria. Como toda madre responsable María trabaja en su sala de belleza, con el fin de vivir mejor ya que puede contar con una fuente extra de ingresos que le permite darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de mejorar su sala de belleza surtiéndola de productos de marcas reconocidas, tintes para el cabello, cremas para el cuidado de la piel y todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y de esta forma llamar la atención de otros nuevos. De esta manera ella espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, 39 years old, is a very hard-working woman who lives with her three children.  Her life partner is in the United States and provides needed assistance.  Like all responsible mothers, Maria works in her beauty salon with the goal of living better since she can count on an extra source of income that permits her to give her children what they need.

Maria is requesting a loan from Integral, with the desire to improve her beauty salon, supplying it with beauty products with recognized brands - hair dyes, skin creams and what is necessary to offer her clients better service, and in this way attract new clients.  Doing this, she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Deysi Yanira

texts.es: Deysi de 40 años de edad, vive junto a tres hijos de los cuales el mayor se dedica a estudiar, los menores aún estudian. Deysi trabaja comercializando pan de forma ambulante, también vende productos de uso personal como: maquillaje, cremas, joyería y otros más los cuales ofrece por medio de catálogos. Ella es una mujer muy responsable quien lucha mucho por salir adelante junto a sus hijos y que gracias a su personalidad alegre y amable cuenta con varios clientes. Deysi solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de cosméticos, perfumes, cremas y champú para ofrecer a sus clientes. El mayor deseo de Deysi es sacar adelante a sus hijos los cuales depende de ella ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en: Deysi, who is 40 years old, lives with her three children, the oldest of whom is in school while the younger two are not yet in school,  Deysi works selling bread from place to place and she also sells personal products such as make-up, creams, jewelry and more which she offers through catalogs.  She is a very responsible person who fights for her and her children to get ahead.  Thanks to her cheerful and friendly personality, she counts on having several customers.  Deysi is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can invest in buying cosmetics, perfumes, creams, and shampoo to offer to her customers.  Deysi’s biggest desire is to provide for her children who depend on her since she is a single mother.

loans.use: to buy make-up to sell.

loans.name: Chatherin

texts.en:
Chatherin is 49 years old and lives in the town of Koboko, in the Arua region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, two of them currently in school.  For the past 8 years, Chatherin has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells cassava flour.  To help expand her business, Chatherin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more cassava flour for resale, to help Chatherin to generate greater profits, and to pay school fees for her children.  

Chatherin hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a vehicle for herself.  Chatherin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Chatherin, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Kosal is 46 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling boiled and grilled eggs for more than four years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, helps her run the business. Her child runs a phone shop and earns about $6 per day.

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Kosal is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase mobile phone spare parts to resell. This purchase will help her child earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the phone shop and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone spare parts to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is applying for his third loan from KADET Ltd after repaying the previous loans successfully. Peter will use this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a 64-year-old businessman. He is widowed and has three children aged 21, 17 and 13 years. Raphael has been running a retail outlet shop for the past eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Raphael will use this loan to buy more stock of mattresses and plastic wares. He will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. Raphael's hopes and dreams are to open another outlet business and to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mattresses and plastic wares

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal, 48 years old, is married and has three children.  She has been practicing dairy farming for seven years and has employed two people to assist her with her farm.  Since Racheal joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access financial resources easily.  This has helped her to educate her children. Racheal wants to practice large-scale farming in the future. She needs a loan of 80,000 KES to buy two dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair an auto rickshaw for a rickshaw transport business.

loans.name: Rodema

texts.en:
This is Rodema, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joey and the mother of their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rodema oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rodema dreams of being able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children and grandchildren a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 52-year-old businesswoman who sells peanuts in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and has seven children. Anastasia has been in this business for the past thirty years and the business is doing great. 

Anastasia was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks her second loan. She plans to use it to purchase more peanuts to supply to her customers. Anastasia will use the profits to repay her loan and to expand the business. She hopes to have a bigger peanut shop.

loans.use: to purchase more peanuts

loans.name: Lorencia

texts.en: Lorencia is 49 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin. She is married and has no children. For the past 6 years, Lorencia has operated a store that sells a variety of products. She has requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Lorencia has been a member of PMPC for 6 months. In the future, she hopes to save some money in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 52, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Tom, a driver, and has children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Victoria works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Victoria operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Victoria earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a cellphone loading station. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Victoria earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Victoria is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Victoria dreams of giving her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. He plants cash crops such as kale, cabbages, maize and beans. He is 67 years old and married to Teresia. Besides the farming business, he also has a retail shop business. This is his fourth loan and he plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting his farm. He will use the generated income to buy more stock of goods to sell in his retail shop. Isaiah hopes to improve his farming and retail shop business and make more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer, 57 years old, lives in Tskaltubo District with his wife and two children (10 and 24 years old). Vladimer requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but had no success. His loan requests were always rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family's only source of income is their small agricultural business; in particular, Vladimer sows greens and sells them in his village. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. Vladimer has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Vladimer will use his loan to build a greenhouse. He will purchase building materials and greenhouse cellophane and construct the greenhouse. He will use part of the loan to purchase organic fertilizer. Vladimer will sow different kinds of vegetables and greens. After fertilization and properly done agricultural work, he will get a good harvest. The harvested products will be sold at a good price, which will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions. Vladimer awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 40 years old, married and has two children, ages 10 and 12. He has a welding business to earn a living. Besides that, he farms for more income generation. His desire is to expand his farm in the future. Isaac has requested a 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy animal feed and a cow.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a cow

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines, is married to Jemuel and has one child. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Melanie oversees operations of the family's tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver remits a boundary (daily quota) to Melanie. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help Melanie continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan, which she will use to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain their motorcycle. Melanie expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Melanie dreams of being able to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married with 3 children. Violeta is 42 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Violeta raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase piglets and feed.

Violeta has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Violeta hopes to expand her business/piggery.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is from a small village of the Tetritskaro district. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children (they are ten and eleven years old).  The children go to the local school. Rusudan’s husband is a cowherd and shepherds the cows. He gets a monthly income. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, Rusudan runs a small dairy farm: she has a calf and a milk cow, and the milk is used in dairy products. The family sells dairy products in the capital city. In addition, Rusudan has a poultry farm of 70 hens. She is a very hard-working woman who has a lot of experience.

Rusudan has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle she owns. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase an additional cow. This will allow Rusudan to get more milk to produce dairy products and increase her sales. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and finance the education of her children. Rusudan awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with 1 child. Gina is 44 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin.

Gina is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. Gina has been doing this for 5 years. Gina has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for 5 months. In the future, Gina hopes to save money for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 32 years old and a cereal shop owner in Magongo, Mombasa. She is married to Ephraim, and they have a 12-year-old child. She ventured into this business six years ago, and her business has been doing well ever since.

This marks her third loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more dry maize, beans, peas and green grams. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open other business outlets. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase more dry maize, beans, peas and green grams

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel used his previous loan amount to buy more clothes for sale, and it has been profitable.

This being his second loan, he plans to use the amount to add more stock of clothes, especially ladies dresses for sale.  He will also add more stock of shoes.

Samuel hopes to grow his business and make more income and thus be able to provide good education for his children.  He also hopes to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Jenepher

texts.en:
Jenepher is a 41-year-old farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya.  She is single, with no children.

She has been in farming for two years producing vegetables, fruits, and cereals that she sells locally to the people in her area.  She also runs a stationery shop as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase irrigation equipment and pipes to curb the problem of poor rainfall that will enhance her production. She aspires to buy a car for her business in future.   High cost of farm inputs is her main challenge.

Jenepher says she likes Juhudi Kilimo's efficiency in loan processing.

loans.use: To buy irrigation equipment and pipes for her farm.

loans.name: Nouhoum

texts.fr:
Monsieur Nouhoum est un homme marié de 51 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son oncle à Bougouni dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus.
Avant de mener l’activité d’achat et la vente des moutons et chèvres, monsieur Nouhoum faisait la pêche qui ne lui a pas réussi. C’est ainsi que depuis 3 ans il mène l’activité d’ achat et de vente des moutons et chèvres. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son ami.
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers sa femme qui est une cliente, il décida de collaborer avec le programme crédit de l’institution avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt. 
Il compte acheter,  15 moutons et 20 chèvres. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans le Wassoulou et effectue ses ventes au marché à bétail de Bougouni et une partie à Bamako. 
Monsieur Nouhoum compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA. Avec ses bénéfices il envisage construire une maison à usage d’habitation et agrandir aussi son entreprise.
texts.en:
Nouhoum is a 51-year-old married man and the father of four children.  He lives with his wife and children at his uncle's place in a neighborhood of Bougouni called "Hérémakono Nord". 

Having never attended modern [secular] school, Nouhoum got involved in income-generating activities at a very young age.  Before buying and selling sheep and goats, he was involved in fishing, but he wasn't very successful. Three years ago, a friend taught him how to buy and sell sheep and goat, and he has been involved in this activity since. 

He learned about Soro Yiriwaso through his wife, who is a client of the institution.  He decided to join their loan program, and he is on his second loan.  He is planning to buy 15 sheep and 20 goats.  

Nouhoum buys his livestock in Bougouni and the Wassoulou region and sells at the cattle market in Bougouni and Bamako.

He is expecting monthly profits to reach 80,000 CFA francs and is planning to use his profits to build a house to live in and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is a hard-working woman who sells fruit and vegetables every day from her home. She has a locale outside her residential house. She is 36 years old and the mother of one child who is in school. Saumu started out with a small amount contributed by her partner. She bought some fruits and vegetables to start with and the profits were helpful. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her husband, she can now buy merchandise in bulk. Saumu is currently running out of stock, and she wants to increase her inventory. She will use this loan to buy vegetables and fruits like tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, kale, and green peas so that she can continue making her sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits like tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, kale, and green peas.

loans.name: Mouhana

texts.en:
Mouhana is a 35-year-old married woman, the mother of three children. She started working a year ago baking Saj bread at home to improve their living conditions. Mouhana is a hard worker and knows that she has to improve her business a lot to keep on helping her husband cover their family's expenses. Her house is her work place. She sells her products to retail shops, groceries, convenience stores and many other different individual customers. Her bread is very tasty as her customers describe, and she is very clean in her work.

Mouhana applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to fix the leakage in her house before the coming winter season. She wants to keep her house a healthy living place for her family and to keep her production in a well managed medium.

This is Mouhana's first cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower. She hopes that her future experience with Al Majmoua will be in opening her dream business: a sewing factory. She has wide experience in this domain and hopes she can afford to buy the necessary machines.

loans.use: to fix the leakage in her house

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 23 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 4 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her market stall which sells sugarcane. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugarcane to cut and sell.  This will help Juliet to generate greater profits and use the profits to pay school fees for her child.  Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy sugarcane to sell

loans.name: Gorety

texts.en:
Gorety is a 31-year-old from Nakuru.  She is married and has one son who is nine years old.

Gorety has a spare parts business that she has been doing for the past seven years.  She has applied for her second loan from KADET LT D to enable her buy more spare parts to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to buy a pickup in the near future.

loans.use: buy spare parts to resell

loans.name: Amelia Argentina

texts.es: Amelia se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres y niñas, ropa interior femenina y masculina, listones de colores, bolsas para regalo y muchos productos más. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora con muchas aspiraciones de salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor, lo cual podrá lograr solamente gracias a su esfuerzo, ya que no cuenta con la ayuda económica de nadie. Su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado central del pueblo en que reside y es muy conocida ya que su mercadería es de muy buena calidad y la ofrece a precios accesibles para las personas. Amelia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de más productos en su bazar, de esta manera ella espera ser la primera opción de las personas para comprar productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
Amelia works selling clothing for women and children, women's and men's underwear, colored ribbons, gift bags, and many other products.  She's a very hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead and have a better life.  She'll be able to achieve this only through her effort because she has no financial support from anybody.  Her stall is located in the central market of the town where she lives and it's very well known because her merchandise is of very good quality and she sells it at prices people can afford.

Amelia is requesting a loan from Integral to invest in buying more products for her store.  This way she hopes to be the first option for people who are buying personal products.

loans.use: to buy clothing, ribbons, and other products

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es: Juan de 41 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre está enfocado a brindar el sustento diario en su hogar. Él vive junto a   sus dos padres de edad avanzada y quienes le ayudan con los quehaceres del hogar y a actividades menos pesadas. Juan trabaja como agricultor en su propia parcela, en donde siembra maíz y frijoles para vender en el mercado central donde los vende a muy buenos precios comparado a otros lugares. El solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los insumos necesarios para la siembra, esperando mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Juan is 41 years old and is a hardworking man. He is always focused on bringing prosperity to his home. He lives with his two elderly parents who help him with the housework and other light chores. Juan works as a farmer on his own parcel of land. He grows corn and beans that he sells in the central market. At the central market he gets better prices than at other markets. He is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the necessary supplies for the growing season. He is hoping to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her food stall where she sells cooked local foods like posho and matoke. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy saucepans, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and cook more food so she has more customers. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to have a good business. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy saucepans to cook food to sell

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is from a village in the Gardabani district. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Maia’s husband works as a driver and her son is a worker. Both of them get a monthly income. 

The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with two milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy production. Maia produces cheese and sells it in the capital city's supermarket. Maia works hard, but her family still doesn't have enough income to make some savings and improve their living conditions. 

Maia requested a loan to renovate her house. The existing house is old and damaged. Maia will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Maia hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: renovate her house

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, 27, a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Rolan, a driver, and is mother to her child. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Mary Grace operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resells it with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like.  Customers are attracted to buy due to her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Mary Grace is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Grace hopes to be able to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 2 years, Judith has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells fast local foods like beans, cassava and matoke. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sauce pans and charcoal stoves, and will help Judith to generate greater profits and use the profits to pay for her child's needs. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to keep growing the business. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy saucepans and charcoal stoves

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is 24 years old. She is a married mother of one young child.  She is a very selfless lady.  Mwanamwinyi  used to sell in a retail shop even before she got married. She transferred those skills to her own retail shop, which has been running for the last three years. With her work and efforts, she is able to provide her family with all the comforts they need.

Mwanamwinyi is requesting this loan to buy essentials such as flour, sugar, rice, oil, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, rice, oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is photographed next to his taxi.  Mohammad is a 36-year-old man.  He is married and is father to three sons and one daughter.  For the past ten months, Mohammad has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and is the only source of income for his family.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of painting and repairing the taxi he drives such as installing new mirrors and wheels. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Mohammad to take additional internal and external requests,  which will improve the family's income positively.

Mohammad's ambition is to buy a new and larger taxi in the future.

loans.use: repair and paint his taxi

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone!  This is 45 -year-old Bintu from Southern area in Bo. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 10 years and 25 years. Three of her children attend school. She started this business to generate income in the home.

Bintu runs a provision shop at the house she lives.  She sells sugar, biscuit, mayonnaise, cocoa and ovaltine.   She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day.   Sleep is the only thing that will prevent her from opening her business. Her children usually help her to run the business.  She does not have any source of income except her business. Bintu says that her business is running well and that she does  not have any competition in the area.

Bintu has requested a loan in order to buy a variety of stock such as sugar, biscuits, mayonnaise, cocoa, and ovaltine.   Her goal is to own a permanent structure for her business.  In the future, she hopes to open a big supper market. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Majidah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Majidah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her husband.

Majidah is a 65-year-old married female from Al Koorah in Jordan.  She has 5 children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses.  She would like to buy a refrigerator.  In the future, Majidah would like to build another room to her home.

loans.use: pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Flor Idalia

texts.es: Flor Idalia de 29 años de edad, es una joven madre de familia muy responsable y dedicada al bienestar de su hogar. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos en casa propia. Flor trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza y uso personal los cuales comercializa por medio de catálogos de diferentes marcas ofreciéndolos de forma ambulante. Flor solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, construyendo un cuarto que sirva de habitación para sus hijos, lo cual gracias a este préstamo podrá lograr ya que las ganancias de ella y su esposo no dan a basto para poder construirlo. Flor es una mujer que desea darle lo mejor a sus hijos por lo que espera construir su habitación y que ellos pueda vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Flor Idalia, 29, is a very responsible young mother who is dedicated to the well-being of her household.  She lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  Flor works selling different brands of beauty and personal products, which she sells via catalogues as a street vendor. 

Flor is requesting a loan from Integral to improve the conditions in her home by building a bedroom for her children.  She'll be able to do this thanks to this loan, because the money she and her husband earn is not enough to build it.

Flor is a woman who wants to give her children the best, so she hopes to build her bedroom so they can live better.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bedroom

loans.name: Maritza Nohemy

texts.es: Maritza de 28 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y dos hijos, ella es madre soltera y trabaja muy duro para poder proveerles de todo lo necesario. Maritza trabaja comercializando frutas y verduras a las afueras del mercado central de su lugar de vivienda, lo que es muy bueno ya que hay una gran afluencia de personas lo que le beneficia en gran manera permitiéndole contar con ganancias aceptables. El deseo de Maritza es poder vivir mejor junto a su familia, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de comprar mayor cantidad de frutas de estación y que cuentan con gran demanda y así mismo para invertir en la  compra de verduras, con lo que ella pueda percibir más ganancias.
texts.en:
Maritza, 28, lives with her mother and two children.  She's a single mother and works very hard to be able to give them everything they need.  Maritza works selling fruits and vegetables outside the central market where she lives.  This is good because there are a lot of affluent people there, which benefits her greatly and gives her acceptable profits.

Maritza's desire for herself and her family is to be able to live better, which is why she's requesting a loan from Integral.  She wants to buy large quantities of fruit in season to meet the demand.  By investing in buying fruit, she'll have better profits.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Gloria Marleni

texts.es: Gloria Marleni de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida José y sus tres hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos reciclables, latas, sillas de metal, botellas entre otros, tiene varios años con el pequeño negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en el reciclado y le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; su negocio esta ubicado en una zona caccesible y transitada por las personas de la localidad, se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere por los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; Gloria es una mujer emprendedora, activa y con muchas metas que desea alcanzar, su mas grande secreto para vencer los obstáculos de camino son la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito;  Gloria es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se dedica todos los días a su trabajo pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar latas, metal, botellas etc. Gloria tiene buenas referencias de pago  asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria Marleni is 38 years old. She lives with her life-partner, José, and their three children in a house that they own. She buys and sells recycling products such as cans, metal chairs and bottles among other items. She has been working at this small business for several years. She has a lot of experience with recycling. This experience allows her to get the best prices for her goods. This business is located in a place that is accessible and convenient for the people in her neighborhood. Many of her customers like her business because they get good prices and service. Gloria is an enterprising, active woman with a goal to succeed. Her biggest secret to success and overcoming obstacles is her love of work. This is the only way to succeed. Gloria works every day, as only with hard work will she succeed.  Like all businesspeople, she would like to grow her business. In order to do this she needs working capital. That is why she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL, which she will use to buy cans, metal, bottles, etc. Gloria has a good history of paying her loans. She is sure that she can pay her debt and help her family achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cans, metal and bottles.

loans.name: Jipar

texts.ru:
Жыпар 41 год, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Жыпар в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  6 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Жыпар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, 2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Жыпар  планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения площади кошары.
texts.en:
Jipar is 41 and married with two children. To provide for her family, she has been growing crops and farming animals for 6 years, having started her business with 6,000 KGS. Thanks to Jipar's hard work her farm currently has 2 heads of cattle with calves and 2 horses. Her monthly income from the farm is around 12,000 KGS.
To develop her business further, Jipar has requested a loan of 50,000 KGS from Bai Tushum & Partners. She will use this sum to buy livestock for fattening and resale. Jipar plans to invest in her business by increasing the size of her sheep barn.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: Julio tiene 21 años de edad estado civil casado tiene 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio. El tiene su propia tienda y víveres ya que poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su tienda,  con el pasar de los años fue incrementando sus clientes y ahora tiene una buena clientela su esposa es quien le ayuda en el negocio. El se levanta a las 6 am para comprar las legumbres frescas en el mercado para luego así poderlas comercializarlas en su tienda. Julio quiere comprarse una camioneta para así poder hacer las comprar en  Guayaquil  que le resultaría más barato y también ingre mentar su tienda y poner una sucursal.          Con el préstamo él se comprara: arroz , azúcar, legumbres y víveres etc.
texts.en: Julio is 21 years old, married, with two children who go to school. He has his own store. Little by little his store is getting bigger. As the years pass, he has gained more customers. Now he has many customers. His wife helps him with his business. He wakes up at 6am in order to buy fresh vegetables at the market, which he later sells in his store. Julio wants to buy a truck so that he can buy his goods in Guayaquil, which would be cheaper for him. He would like to increase the size of his store and add an office. With this loan he will buy rice, sugar, vegetables and perishable goods.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, vegetables, perishable goods, etc.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 33-year-old married man from Baqa'a in Jordan. He has two children. He requested a 1,500 JOD loan for his coffee booth. Mohamed sells coffee, soft drinks, and candy. He would like to expand his project and buy goods and materials for the booth. In the first stage, Mohamad sold coffee and hot drinks. Now he wants to expand his project and start selling sandwiches. In the future he would like to open a small cafeteria where customers can be seated. Mohamad would like to improve his family's living conditions and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to pay for materials for his coffee booth

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is 52 years old. She is a widow who lives with her four school-going children. She works selling khangas (traditional pieces of fabric worn by women in East Africa) door to door. Mesalimu is a determined woman despite her advanced age. She has had this business for several years and she has gained a lot of experience in sales. She has built a large clientele because she is very pleasant and helpful. People recommend her because she has top quality khangas that can last up to four years.

She has many dreams she hopes to achieve. Every day, she gets up trusting that with time, she will manage to earn herself a more prosperous future. She will put in maximum effort because she knows that it's the only way she will reach success. Since she is alone without any support, she asks for support through a loan in the amount of KSH 30,000 to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

Mesalimu has good credit references and is responsible. She has already serviced another loan from Yehu. She is sure that she will be able to pay off the debt within the stipulated time.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Delgado tiene 29 años estado civil soltero tiene un hijos que estudia en la escuela siempre a Él le ha gustado la mecánica desde muy pequeño por eso ahora trabaja en lo que es la mecánica automotriz no tiene ningún ayudante y por lo general ese trabajo lo hace solo ahora uno de los  sueños de Juan es agrandar su taller de reparación de vehículos porque por ahora le falta muchas herramientas todavía. Pues Juan poco a poco se ha ido ganado los  clientes para el negocio pues el ya está pensando en tener ayudantes para su negocio. Con el préstamo Juan quiere comprar cosas como: una gata hidráulica, torques, y más herramientas que todavía le hacen falta etc.
texts.en: Juan Delgado is 29 years old and single. He has children that always go to school. Juan has liked mechanics since he was little. This is why he is now an auto mechanic. He doesn’t have an assistant and does his work alone. One of Juan’s dreams is to increase the size of his auto repair shop. He still doesn’t have many of the tools that he needs. Slowly Juan has increased his customer base. He has been thinking about hiring helpers for his business. With this loan Juan will buy things such a hydraulic lift, wrenches and some of the tools that he still needs.

loans.use: to buy a hydraulic lift, wrenches and more tools, etc.

loans.name: Ektimal

texts.en:
For cultural reasons Ektimal prefers that her photo not be on the Internet.  Thus the above photo is of her husband.

Ektimal is 40 years old and married from Hay Nazal in Jordan.  She has four children..

She has requested a loan of JOD 400 to pay for her home improvement expenses. Ektimal wants to paint and improve her house.  In the future, she would like to have a project in her home.

loans.use: to pay home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Zuleima Carolina

texts.es: Zuleima Carolina de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Miguel y su madre; ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos por catálogo, como cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su hogar y en forma ambulante se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que venden es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Zuleima es una mujer  activa, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora todos los días se esfuerza por trata de cumplir sus sueños sabe que solo con constancia y amor al trabajo podrá alcanzar ese éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del producto y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, perfumes, cosméticos etc. Zuleima Carolina tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Zuleima Carolina, 26, lives with her life partner Miguel and her mother.  She works buying and selling catalogue products such as perfume and cosmetics, among other items.  She's had the business for several years and it has given her a lot of experience, which allows her to get the best profits.  She sells from home and on the street.  She has acquired a lot of customers because people prefer her for the high quality and affordable prices of her products.  Also, her service is incomparable; she's always ready to serve.

Zuleima is an active woman who is dedicated to her job and strives every day.  She makes the effort to try to realize her dreams.  She knows that only with perseverance and love for her work will she be able to be successful.

In the last few weeks demand for her products has increased and she wants to fill it.  This is why she's requesting a loan from Integral so she can buy cream, perfume, cosmetics, etc.

Zuleima Carolina has a good payment record.  She's very responsible and is certain she'll be able to pay back the debt.  She also trusts that she'll give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cream, perfume, and cosmetics

loans.name: Stelie

texts.en: Stelie is 30 years old. She is married to a farmer, and they have two children. All her children attend different schools. She sells bananas, and she has been running her business for three years. With the loan, she wants to add more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elisabeth is 43 years old. She has three children aged between 6 and 13. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for five years. She wants the loan to buy more vegetables such as tomatoes, eggplant and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables such as tomatoes, eggplant and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en: Nisreen is a 34 year old divorced female from Sahab in Jordan. She has a child and requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for clothes to sell. She wants to buy clothes and resell them from her house. In the future she would like to make a room in her home especially for her project. Nisreen would like to improve living conditions for herself, her son and her family after her divorce.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to resell.

loans.name: Henry Edison

texts.es: Henry tiene 37 años de edad estado civil soltero. El empezó a trabajar repartiendo cilindro de gas. El vio que ese negocio resultado él se independizo y ase ahora tiene su propio negocio la cual comercializa tanques de gas de uso domestico. El sueño de el es tener un local grande para ahí poder comercializar su cilindro de gas. Con el préstamo compra: tanques  de gas , mejorara su local
texts.en: Henry is 37 years old and single. Henry’s first job was selling propane canisters. Eventually he started his own business selling propane tanks that are used in the home. His dream is to have a bigger business location where he can sell his propane tanks. With this loan he will buy propane tanks and improve the site of his business.

loans.use: to buy propane tanks and improve his business location.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, instant products, beverages, and other products for her store

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en: Liberata is a widow aged 49. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for five years. She wants the loan to buy more potatoes, bananas and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, bananas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is grateful for the continual support she is receiving from Kiva through Yehu. She is a visionary woman who strives to get ahead in life. With the previous loan, she was able to increase her sales. Her living standards also improved.

Asha is taking out a new loan to invest in her existing business. With this loan, she will be able to purchase ingredients including wheat flour, five liters of cooking oil, and baking powder. She hopes to earn more income from this investment.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients including wheat flour, five liters of cooking oil, and baking powder.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia est une femme mariée de 50 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. 
Ayant abandonnée l’école en classe de 5ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), elle décida de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle a commencé à suivre sa sœur pour apprendre le processus de la préparation et vente des jus de fruits et glaces. Elle mène maintenant cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et maitrise bien son activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée dans le quartier. Madame Rokia a connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association solidaire dans le quartier. 
Après 4 prêts solidaires et vu l’évolution de son activité elle décida de venir au prêt individuel dans laquelle elle est à son 3 ème prêt.
Elle est à sa 7eme année expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elle n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Tous ses prêts son bien remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter, 2 sacs du sucre, 1 carton sucre-vanille, 35 kilo de gingembre et 1 sac de 50 kilo de dah. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières dans le marché de Bougouni et  Sikasso. Ses jus sont vendus par ses employés à la maison, au marché,  devant les écoles et dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA. 
Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise et construire sa maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Rokia is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.  She lives with her husband and children in the "Hérémakono Nord" neighborhood of Bougouni.  

Rokia left school after having attended five years of primary school (Malian educational system), and she decided to get involved in income-generating activities.  She followed her sister's footsteps and learned from her how to prepare and sell fruit juices and ice-creams.  She has been involved in this activity for over ten years now and has become very proficient in her field.  Her products are in high demand in her neighborhood.

Rokia was introduced to Soro Yiriwaso by a solidarity association in her neighborhood.  After taking four solidarity loans, and given the expansion of her business, she decided to apply for individual loans.  Rokia is now taking her third individual loan.  She has been a client of Soro Yiriwaso for seven years and has never experienced any repayment difficulty.  All her loans were duly repaid.

She is planning to buy two bags of sugar, one box of vanilla sugar, 35 kg of ginger and one 50-kg bag of dah (a species of hibiscus used in infusions).  She buys her supplies at the Bougouni and Sikasso markets.  Rokia's employees sell her juices from home, at the market, in front of schools and in various neighborhoods of Bougouni.

With this loan, Rokia is expecting monthly profits to reach 60,000 CFA francs.  She is also planning to expand her business and to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make and sell juices.

loans.name: Peter   Muthangya

texts.en: Peter is 35 years old and is married with two children. He operates a taxi transport business in a competitive environment. He has engaged in this business for three years. He also does farming to generate more income. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business through training in business-management skills. Peter dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary, 19 and married, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has one dependent son who is too young for school. To make a living, she has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland and also planting pineapple to earn extra income. She is able to earn about 26,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manages to save about 2,000 KHR per day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her business.

Nary’s Group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Nary completely repaid her prior loan, which has provided her family sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. Nary is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice and pineapple plantation. She hopes her crop yield will be more profitable and sell for a good price. She also hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice and pineapple plantation

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en: Brigitte is 28 years old. She is married with four children aged between 3 months and 7 years old. She sells timber and has been in this business for 3 years. She wants the loan to buy more timber and other wood that people like to use. She will use the profits from the business to develop her savings.

loans.use: To buy more timber and wood for resale.

loans.name: Sousan

texts.en: Sousan is 44 years old. She sells animals, especially goats, and has been in this business for 2 years. She wants the loan to buy more goats for resale. She will use the profits from the business to develop her savings.

loans.use: To buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Souley

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souley est un homme marié de 39 ans et père de 5 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille monogame à Bougouni dans le quartier Torakabougou.
Après l’école coranique, il est resté longtemps sans emploi. C’est ainsi qu’après mure réflexion, il décide d’apprendre auprès de son oncle les activités d’achat et de vente de boeufs. Après avoir eu un petit fonds de commerce à travers un ami, il décide de s’installer à son propre compte dans la même activité que son oncle.à savoir l’achat vente de boeufs.
Avec une expériences de plus de 15 ans, il maîtrise son activité dans laquelle il est très sollicité et apprécié.
Après avoir correctement remboursé les cinq précédents prêt il est à son sixième prêt qui sera utilisé pour  acheter  10 boeufs.  Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et environs. La vente se fait au marché à bétail de Bougouni. Ses clients sont composés surtout des bouchers et des commerçants en provenance de Bamako. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 145.000 FCFA qui servira en subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Monsieur Souley is a married man and the father of five children. He lives with his wife and children in a monogamous family in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni.

After Koranic school, he was unemployed for a long time, so after careful consideration, he decided to learn how to buy and sell cows from his uncle. 

He had a small business with a friend, and then decided to start his own business doing the same work as his uncle i.e. buying and selling cows. 

He now has 15 years experience, and has mastered his business where he is sought after and appreciated. He has repaid his five previous loans, and will use this sixth loan to buy 10 cows. He buys his cows in and around Bougouni, and sells his cows at the livestock market in Bougouni. His clients are mainly butchers and shopkeepers form Bamako. 

With this loan, he would like to earn an monthly profit of 145.000 FCFA that he'll use to pay for his family expenses and repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Edith  Waceke

texts.en: Edith is a hardworking, 30-year-old businesswoman who is married with four children. She sells onions in a busy business environment with reliable customers. She has been engaged in this business for two years. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her savings skills through training in financial management. Edith dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy onions for resale.

loans.use: To buy onions for resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is glad now that her retail shop is flourishing. Her dream is to see her two children acquire a good education. Mwanamisi is taking out another loan to increase her inventory. Through this investment, she will be sure that her monthly income will increase even as she continues providing for her family. Mwanamisi will use this loan to purchase of bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, salt, oils, and other goods.

loans.use: purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, salt, oils, and other goods.

loans.name: Sithorn's Group

texts.en:
Sithoun is a 37-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom (a son) is dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Sithoun has earned a living by running a small food stall (offering breakfast) in the market in the local area for five years. She is able to earn about 22,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manages to save about 15,000 KHR per day after her daily expenses.

Sithorn has been with VisionFund for three cycles, whereas her group members are first-time borrowers with VisionFund. Sithoun's past loans, which she successfully paid back, have relieved the burden on her family. Now she is leading her group of three to request a loan. She will use her portion to buy ingredients for her business, including rice, pork, and vegetables. She hopes to increase her income so as to keep making good progress in her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients including rice, pork, and vegetables

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne operates a butcher shop to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to buy meat to sell. This helped her improve her business. Anne dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested for another loan of 50,000 KES to buy more meat for sale.

loans.use: to buy more meat for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 34 years old and has four children aged between 3 and 10. Three of them go to school. He sells bedsheets and bed covers and has been in business for 15 years. He wants the loan to add more bedsheets and bed covers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a store for him to use in the business.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets and bed covers for sale.

loans.name: Domithile

texts.en: Domithile is 42 years old. She sells wood and has been in this business for 10 years. She wants the loan to buy more wood for resale. She plans to use the profits from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more wood for resale.

loans.name: Shodmon

texts.ru:
Шодмон житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 64 года. Он живет с женой. Шодмон является отцом пятерых детей. Его дети занимаются предоставлением услуг и торговлей. Дети Шодмона живут отдельно. 
Шодмон обратился в нашу организацию с целью получения кредита для того чтобы начать свою деятельность и заняться своим делом. С юных лет Шодмон занимался земледелием и растениеводством. По состоянию здоровья он уже год как не занимается растениеводством. Шодмон трудолюбивый человек. Он желает (намерен) заняться скотоводством. 
Шодмон хочет закупить крупнорогатый скот и разводить скот у себя дома. Он хочет купить корову для того чтобы получать натуральное молоко, а также закупить бычков и телят чтобы через несколько месяцев продать.
texts.en:
Shodmon, age 64, is a resident of the J. Rumy district.  He lives with his wife and he is the father of five children.  His children, who now live on their own, work in the service industry or are involved in commerce.

Shodmon has turned to our organization in order to receive a loan to start a business and resume his activity.  From a young age, he has been involved in farming and agriculture, but for health reasons he hasn't been able to work in agriculture for a year.  

Shodmon is a hard-working man and he would like to get involved in animal-husbandry.  He intends to buy cattle and raise his livestock at home.  He wants to buy a cow to get fresh milk and would also like to purchase young bulls and calves for resale in a few months.

loans.use: to buy a cow, young bulls and calves.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a courageous woman and a mother of four. She faced a very difficult time after her husband‘s failure in business. She decided to go to work herself and support her family for a better future. Seven years ago she started stitching clothing for people around her home. Today, she has gained a lot of appreciation and serves well in her community. However, due to fewer financial resources, she has been unable to fulfill the demands of customers. She contacted Kashf foundation to purchase raw materials to complete the orders on time. She is in her second loan cycle and has borrowed 25000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc. This will create the means to increase revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She desires to use the part of revenues on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Judy  Wacera

texts.en: Judy is a hardworking 34-year-old business lady with two children. She operates a grocery store to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She also depends on her husband's salary from welding for financial support. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained on business management skills. Judy dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her grocery store.
