She currently works alone, monday to sunday, from 6:00 am until 11:00 pm. María's goal is to expand her business, in order to have a greater income and to be able to finish building her house, because her husband is a taxi driver and does not make enough money.

With the loan, she wants to buy supplies for her store, like oils, grains, sweets, candies, sodas, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies like oils, grains, sweets, candies, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 49 años tiene 3 hijos que son de las edades de 19,22 y 24 todos ellos se encuentran estudiando, la Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de Dvds de música  en su puestos de venta que se encuentra en una populosa feria de la ciudad de El Alto,   este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de un televisor para mostrar sus videos a los clientes, la  Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos según la temporada para vender, su deseo para su negocio es crecer más y ayudar a su familia, ya que esta es la actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old. She has 3 children aged 19, 22 and 24. All of them are in school. Maria sells music DVDs at her sales locale in a popular market in the city of El Alto. This loan is her second cyle with the institution. Maria is going to use this loan to invest in buying a television to show the videos to her customers. Maria faces challenges in her business, such as the lack of cash to buy the products. She is going to use the profits to keep buying a variety of products according to the season. She wants her business to grow more and to help her family, because this activity is her family's support.

loans.use: to buy a television and DVD and CD merchandise.

loans.name: Jairo Francisco

texts.es:
El Sauce una bella ciudad con característica agro-ecológica está ubicado a 90 km del departamento de León, es un Maravilloso pueblo rodeado de una linda naturaleza, donde la mayoría de sus viviendas son fabricadas con ladrillos de barro y techos de tejas, se caracteriza por ser una zona donde se dedica al comercio,  como es el caso del señor Jairo francisco

Jairo Francisco es nacido y criado en este municipio con buenas costumbre, conoce a muchas personas que por amistad que tiene vende mucho en su negocio.

Empezó su negocio desde hace 5 años, vendiendo pastillas para mejorar la salud, hoy en día con el crédito que le ha financiado Kiva y Ceprodel ha logrado diversificar su inventario de medicina para el beneficio de sus clientes, pero debido a la necesidad de la población él está solicitando crédito para la compra de: Tabcin, dolo vitalgia, ser tal compuesto y entre otros que ayuden para el bien saludable de sus clientes. 


Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estos pequeños créditos que ayudan a mejorar muchos su negocio que necesitan de capital de trabajo para salir adelante y ser estables en su competencia y de la misma forma agradece por la atención que le hemos brindado y por haberle ido a ofrecer el crédito
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful agro-ecological city located 90 kilometers from the department of León.  It is a marvelous town, surrounded by wonderful nature, where most of the homes are made of adobe bricks and tiled roofs.  It is mainly a commercial area, which holds true in the case of Jairo Francisco.

Jairo Francisco was born and raised in this town of good habits.  He knows many people through friendships and sells a lot in his business.

He started his business five years ago, selling pills to improve health.  Now, with a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel, he has diversified his medicine inventory for the benefit of his customers.  But, due to the needs of the population, he is requesting a loan to buy Tabcin, dolo vitalgia, which is another health-care product for his customers.

He is grateful to KIVA and Ceprodel for their support with these small loans, which help many businesses in need of working capital to get ahead and become stable in their competitiveness.  He is also grateful for the attention shown him and for granting him this loan.

loans.use: To buy a medication called Tabcin, dolo vitalgia.

loans.name: Sonnia Maribel

texts.es: Sonnia  es costurera, tiene 36 años de estado civil soltera  tiene dos hijos que estudian  en la escuela.  Sonnia   comenzó hace 10 años con su liquidación de su ultimo trabajo. Se compro una máquina de coser  y de ahí poco a poco fue aumentado sus clientes con arreglo de ropa y confecciones hasta llegar a tener su propio taller de costura .en la actualidad ella se  levanta  a las 6:00am a dejar a sus hijas a la escuela y de ahí a las 8:00am abre  el taller ,el deseo   y anhelo de Sonnia  es también ser una diseñadora de modas . Con el préstamo ella quisiera comprar implementos como: hilos, telas, cierres, y otra máquina de coser  etc.
texts.en:
Sonnia, 36, is a seamstress and single, with two school-aged children.  She began her business ten years ago when she was let go from her last job.  She bought a sewing machine and, little by little, increased her customer base through her sewing and alterations.  Now she has her own sewing workshop and gets up at 6:00 a.m. to drop her daughters off at school.  She opens her shop at 8:00 a.m.

Sonnia's goal is also to become a fashion designer.  She will use the loan to buy supplies such as thread, closures, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.use: To buy thread, closures, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Rose Kwamboka

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old hardworking business lady, married with three children who are in school. She operates a grocery store to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for more than five years and has employed three people. Rose had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business and she was also able to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of operating more grocery stores in different locations in the future. Rose has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy fruits, vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a married man and a father to five children. He is 40 years old and earns a living through masonry work. He has been a mason for 15 years and people like him for his perfect work. He says that the major challenge he faces is that some of the people whom he serves are not faithful and therefore take long to repay the debt after working for them. He builds roofs, walls, cemented tanks, etc. 

Currently, some of his tools are worn out and therefore not very efficient to deliver the services to its optimal. He is therefore asking for this loan to buy masonry equipment like plumbing tools and a new trowel, among others. He wants to fulfill the orders he has received.

loans.use: to buy masonry equipment like plumbing tools and a new trowel, among others.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en: Mourine is a hardworking 30-year-old business lady and is married. She makes and sells doughnuts to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for three years and has employed two people. Besides, she operates a beauty salon to generate more income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to manage her business because she has been trained on business management skills. Mourine dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested for a loan of 15,000 KES to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
Ms Pathani is a 32-year-old, spirited widow woman. After the death of her husband, she was in trouble to manage all the expenditures of the family alone. Six years ago, she started the business of milk selling to support her family. Being a single parent, she is liable to fulfill her children’s basic needs such as food, health and clothing. She is getting a healthy profit from this business and she is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She counts a good client list and her customers are increasing day by day. 

She is satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation so she requested for a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy another buffalo to milk to meet the demands of her customers. She wishes to give a better future to her children and also wants to upgrade the condition of her house. She is hopeful of making her dreams come true through her efforts and determination.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo in milk.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en: Antoinette is 56 years old. She has one child aged 27. She sells sorghum as a wholesaler. She wants the loan to buy more sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for selling.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan, a 49-year-old married woman, is a mother for three boys. She has a small embroidery and tailoring business at home, making bed covers, baby blankets and pillow covers for sale. She has applied for this loan to buy more thread, fabric and a new sewing machine to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more thread, fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Gilda Marlene

texts.es: Gilda tiene 28 años de edad estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos. Ella comenzó de a poquita mercadería  de ropa, también confecciona sabanas y también quiere un taller de costura su sueño es ampliar su negocio y brindarle trabajo a personas que no tenga ella trabaja de 8:00am hasta las 16:00pm. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, blusas
texts.en: Gilda is 28 years old, her marital status is married and she has 2 children. She started her business with a small amount of clothing merchandise, she also makes sheets and she wants a sewing shop. Her dream is to expand her business and provide work for people that are unemployed. She works from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. With the loan she will purchase merchandise like pants, skirts and blouses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like pants, skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim, a 36-year-old married man, is a father for two boys. He owns a small restaurant that he wants to enhance, and for that he has applied for this loan to buy some new equipment and renew the internal decorations.

loans.use: to buy some new equipment.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en: Shadi, who is a 22-year-old young man, has been married for a short period of time. He is employed and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover his cost of living. Currently, Shadi is finishing his house, but due to a money shortage because of his wedding expenses, some renovations have been stopped for awhile. So he is requesting a loan from Faten to continue finishing his house. First, he will install tiles in his house and then install new windows and doors. Taking this loan will enable Shadi and his wife to move into their house soon, before the Winter season is coming. He is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To finish his house by installing tiles, windows and doors.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal, a 44-year-old married man, is supporting a family of eight members. He is a sand artist. He draws with colored sand in different shaped bottles, and he can also write names for those who buy them as gifts.  With his talent he has participated in many art exhibitions and tourism markets. He has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of raw material he has and to get more bottles so he can participate in more exhibitions with a larger number of his works.

loans.use: to get more sand bottles and raw material.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 46, is a mother of five children. She is married and lives in  Congo Town. Her children are between the ages of 6 and 27. Three of them stay  with her at home and are attending  school, while the other two live outside the home and are independent.  Her husband serves as a security guard, 

Rebecca started in this business with a little amount that she had been saving.  She has been selling spare ribs, chicken, and pigs' feet in the market for the past twenty years. She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods to improve the business.  She has requested her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more spare ribs, chicken and pigs' feet to increase her sales.  Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spare ribs, chicken and pigs' feet to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas offers fresh (buko) coconut juice within his village and nearby villages. He is a married man with two infant children. His wife owns an internet cafe, which she has run for seven years.

Jonas's coconut juice is marketable within their village due to the good taste, and it is used as an alternative medicine for kidney trouble and urinary tract infection. According to Jonas, he has another stall at Diffun Quirino. Three of his helpers manage his stall at Diffun, while Jonas is responsible for running his stall located at the Public Market of Cordon. He aims to earn a greater income so he can uplift his family's living condition out of poverty and educate his two children. For now, he struggles because of inadequate capital due to an increase of household expenses and rentals for his stalls. With regard to his situation, he requested a loan of PHP 18,000, which allows him to buy more fresh coconut. He knows that he could make his dream possible through continuous hard work, patience and dedication to his business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh coconut for his vending stall

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is 49 years old and married. She is from Bacolod, Ozamis City. She has five grown children who have helped her in taking care of her banana plantation. She and her family have been raising bananas for eight years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Lolina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and to pay the weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay the weeding costs.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas en variedad,  tiene varios años de poseer el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, ella es muy conocida en la zona  y comercia desde su hogar se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios realmente accesibles además de un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de las personas; Adelina es una mujer entregada a su labor, enérgica y muy luchadora todos los días se esfuerza por encontrar las mejores oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en los últimos meses ha tenido aumento en sus ventas y quiere aprovechar este momento para realizar una nueva inversión y así extender el negocio pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas y bebidas por mayor. Adelina tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Adelina is 39 years old, lives with her children, and sells a variety of snacks and drinks.  She’s had this business for several years and this has given her lots of experience and allows her to bring in better earnings.  She is well known in the zone, sells from her home, and has many customers because she always has what they need at good prices and provides good customer service.

Adelina is dedicated to her work.  She is full of energy and works hard every day to find the best opportunities for her success.  Her sales have increased in the past months and she wants to take advantage of this momentum by making a new investment to expand her business.  She doesn’t have enough capital, so she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL in order to buy snacks and drinks in quantity.

Adelina has a good payment record, is very responsible, and assures us that she will repay on time while maintaining financial security in her home.

loans.use: to buy snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is from the district of Telavi in Kakheti. He is 23 years old and lives with his parents, grandfather, 16-year-old sister, brother and sister-in-law. His sister goes to a local school. Tamaz’s brother works as a distributor and his sister-in-law is a teacher. Both of them earn a monthly salary. Tamaz’s grandfather is a pensioner. 

Tamaz runs a small animal husbandry business. He has four pigs and plans to sell them during the winter season when the prices are higher for the new year. Additionally, he has a peach garden and sells peaches at the local open market. Tamaz and his father also earn a small monthly income as farm workers. 

Tamaz is a very hardworking young man, with a great desire to get ahead.

With the credit he receives, Tamaz will purchase pigs. He will place the pigs in a shed located in his yard, raise and fatten them, and then sell them at a higher price. This will increase the family's income. With the increased income, Tamaz plans to purchase calves and expand his animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a businesswoman who sells furniture and household appliances for cash and on credit. She started this business four years ago with a variety of products. 

Svetlana hopes to receive a loan from AqroInvest so that she can invest in more products to increase her sales. This is her third loan from AqroInvest. With this new loan, in the amount of 2,000 AZN, she will buy two wooden double beds. This will enable her to sell them to her customers at a good price.

loans.use: to buy two wooden double beds.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old. He is a single man but he supports his parents. 

For the past three years, Peter has been selling retail goods such as jugs, cups, purses, sandals and albums. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.
 
He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy more stock of watches, albums and torches to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his sibling. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land on which to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of watches, albums and torches to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 36 years old and lives in Tiribe. She is married and has one son, who is currently in school. Her business is selling fish. She has been in this business for two years and it is located in her home. She would like this loan to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to increase her income through this investment.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 30 years old and married. She is a mother of two children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling ladies' clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

Bilha was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. She is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000 to buy additional stock of clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses and so on to sell to her customers. 

Bilha will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of clothing such as blouses, skirts and dresses.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle.

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 43 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Gema would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a jewelry business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more jewelry to sell to her customers.

Gina has been in this business for three years. Gina earns additional income from frozen foods.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married and has five children. Three are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mila is 41 years old.

Mila has a food business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mila has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria Magdalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell.

NWTF is relisting Maria Magdalina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for repair of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old and married. She has seven children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Myrna aspires to save enough money to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and married. She has five children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Pima Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Pima est composé de sept femmes (6 mariées et 1 veuve) qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent  majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massabla coura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Les sept précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales, d’habits et de condiments alimentaires.
MARIAM, qui est la présidente du groupe  et la seule assise, fait l’achat vente de céréales : maïs, riz, mil, fonio arachide, haricot, etc.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 tonne de riz, 500 kilos de fonio et 500 kilos d’arachide avec les paysans producteurs de Bougouni et environs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Pima group is composed of 7 women (6 married, 1 widow) with an average age of 42 and, on average, 5 children. They mostly live in nuclear family environments in the Massabla Coura district of Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and business relationships, and friendships. In order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better do business, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are on their 8th loan. The 7 preceeding loans were correctly repaid. The women in the group sell cereals, clothing and condiments.

Mariam, the group leader and the only woman sitting down, buys and sells cereals such as corn, rice, millet and fonio, as well as groundnuts and beans, etc. She plans to use her loan to buy 1 tonne of rice, 500 kgs of fonio and 500 kgs of groundnuts from the farmers of Bougouni and the surrounding area. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door to her retail clientèle, made up of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 80 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Mary Philip

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 13. All of them go to school.

Mary runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 1,300 SDG to purchase beans and many other items. Mary has no other source of income.

In five years Mary would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Mary says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like beans.

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekadi, sont toutes des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 24 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana chef lieu de commune de Guegneka, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de céréales, de parfums, de condiments, des habillements et du lait.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djekadi sont à leur  premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso 
NANA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 7 sacs de patates douce, 3 sacs d’igname avec les producteurs de Beleko, N’Golobougou et de Massigui pour ensuite les vendre sur place en détail, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekadi group are all married women with an average age of 24 and, on average, 4 children, and who mostly live in extended, traditional family environments in the town of Fana, the main town of the commune of Guegneka, in the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and friendships. They sell potato tubers, cereals, perfumes, condiments, clothing and milk. The women of the Djekadi group are on their first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

Nana, the second person from the left in the picture, plans to buy 7 sacks of sweet potatoes and 3 sacks of yams from the farmers of Beleko, N’Golobougou and Massigui, so that she can sell them locally to a retail clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs, a part of which will be used to take care of her family's needs, and a part of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy potato tubers.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 27 years old, married and the father of two children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town. He earns a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by a credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of KES 40,000. He is going to add the loan to his personal savings so that he can purchase another motorcycle in order to expand his business. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children. His goal for the future is to continue growing his transport business with a view of owning a fleet of motorcycles so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 42 years old and married. She has two children.

Trinidad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Trinidad has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Trinidad aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Socorro works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling fishing nets in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Socorro is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more nylon and tools for making fishing nets.

Socorro has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nylon and tools for making fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, meat and fish to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Muglani

texts.en:
Mughlani is a 22-year-old young woman. She has no kid. She is a newly married woman. Because the income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, she decided to help her husband in his business of milk selling to contribute economically to her home and have a better quality of life. The man shown in the photo is Muglani’s husband.

To meet the increasing demand of customers and get an increase in sales, they want to purchase another buffalo for their business, so she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs). In this way, they will be able to do better in covering family expenses and improving their living conditions. Their dream is to build a home for their own family in the future because now they are living with their parents.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 43-year-old married woman from Jarash in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 1,000 JOD loan to pay for home improvement expenses. Najah wants to build a roof for her son's home, as it does not have a roof yet.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses for her son's home.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is still a university student. After repaying her first loan, she decided to apply for another one to continue paying for the university and go on with the process of getting her BA certificate.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Felix esta sacando este prestamo para la compra de semillas para siembra de yuca y tambien de sorgo para la fabricacion de escobas, le fue muy bien con el anterior credito por este motivo solicito de nuevo otro credito ya que esta fecha hay mucha demanda de sus productos.
texts.en: Felix is taking this loan to buy seeds to grow yucca and sorghum to make brooms.  The last loan went very well for him.  That is the reason that he is requesting a new loan.  There is now a great demand for his products.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant yucca and sorghum to make brooms.

loans.name: Gumercinda Colombia

texts.es: Gumercinda estado civil soltera tiene 62 años de edad  tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad .Ella comenzó en la venta de comida trabajando para un hermano de ella, actualmente ella se independizo y trabaja junto a su hija .Ella trabaja desde la6.am hasta 15:00pm. su meta es tener un gran restaurante de comidas típicas ecuatorianas .Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar una cocina una y ollas y platos
texts.en:
Gumercinda, age 62, is single and has three grown children.  She started selling food by working for one of her sisters.  She is now independent, and she works together with her daughter.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.  

Her goal is to have a big restaurant that serves typical Ecuadorian dishes.  She will use the loan to buy a stove, pots, and plates.

loans.use: to buy a stove, pots, and plates.

loans.name: Ujumbe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Tegera, leader du groupe d’affaire «Ujumbe », est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 35  ans, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient encore à l’école primaire. Elle est  vendeuse de matériaux de construction.  Son mari est constructeur maître maçon. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un dépôt. Il y a 8 ans révolus,elle exerce ces petites activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  40 sacs de ciments, 30 bars de fers, 12 boites de vernis, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Tegera is a young entrepreneur and leader of the business group "Ujumbe". She is 35 years old and mother of six young children, all of whom are still in primary school.

Tegera sells construction supplies. Her husband is a master mason. She keeps her goods in a warehouse. She has been selling goods for eight years now. During that time, she has gone through ten loan cycles with Hekima.

This new loan will allow her to stock up with 40 bags of cement, 30 iron bars, 12 containers of varnish, etc. In addition, she wants to expand her business and see her children grow up comfortably. She would like to thank Hekima for all that it does to help poor women excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy 40 bags of cement, 30 iron bars, 12 containers of varnish, etc.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguitougou, sont toutes des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 30 ans, 4 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana Région de Koulikoro 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de condiments, des habillements et des fruits.                                                                                                                           
Les femmes du groupe Djiguitougou sont à leur  premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.  
FATOUMATA, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 2 sacs de tubercules, 1 sac de spaghetti, 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile et des condiments pour la préparation des plats alimentaires qu’elle vend aux clients au bord du goudron à côté du radio Guegneka à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguitougou group are all married women with an average age of 30 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in extended, traditional family environments in the town of Fana, in the Koulikoro region. They got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and friendships. They sell potato tubers, condiments, clothing and fruit. The women of the Djiguitougou group are on their first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

Fatoumata, the first person on the left in the picture, plans to buy 2 sacks of potato tubers, 1 bag of spaghetti, 1 20-litre can of oil and some condiments for the preparation of the meals that she sells on the roadside, near the Guegneka radio station, to a retail clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs, a part of which will be used to take care of her family's needs, and a part of which will be reinvested in her catering business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her catering business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Ms. Fatima is 51-year-old energetic woman. She is doing a business of gloves sewing for 10 years. She is a married woman and has nine children. Her husband is employed as an operator but his income is insufficient to cover all the household expenditures. 

Fatima started her own business with very little capital; she had not a single machine. But with the support of Kashf Foundation, she has bought her own machine. She is very popular in her street and has gained many customers. She makes enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue her operations, she requested for a loan of Rs.30,000 to purchase another sewing machine for her daughter to assist her in fulfilling orders of the customers. She is been in association with Kashf Foundation for years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wants to give a better future and quality education to her children. Her husband is very happy to see his wife's business growth. Her aim is to build a better home for her children.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine for her daughter so she can assist her in fulfilling orders of her customers.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla, 50 years old, is a conservative woman. For that reason, she asked her son to take her place in the photo. 

Nahla has two sons and two daughters. One of her sons, “Jomaa,” works on his own. He buys broken motors or used ones and repairs them to re-sell. His mother has applied for this loan to help her son buy some maintenance pieces and new repair tools to help her son improve the service he provides.

loans.use: to help her son buy some maintenance pieces

loans.name: Carmen Miriam

texts.es: Carmen tiene 60 años de edad estado civil viuda tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad .Su ingreso económico es con la venta de productos cosméticos en un mini bazar que ella tiene ese ha sido su medio de sustento después que falleciera su esposo pues le va bien en su negocio su sueño es incrementar mas su negocio poner más variedad a sus productos. Su horario de trabajo es en las tardes cuando le ofrece el producto  a sus vecinos y en la noche cuando va a una iglesia evangélica donde ella asiste  .Con el préstamo  ella va a comprar todo lo que es cosmético como: perfumes , cremas , colonias etc.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 60 year old widow, and she has two grown children.  She gets her income from selling cosmetic products at a mini variety store that she has.  This has been her means of support after her husband died.  Her business is going well for her.

Her dream is to increase her business by having a greater variety of products.  Her work schedule is in the afternoons, when she sells her products to her neighbors, and in the evening, when she goes to her evangelical church.

She will use the loan to buy all types of cosmetics like perfume, cream, and cologne, etc.

loans.use: to buy all types of cosmetics like perfume, cream, and cologne, etc.

loans.name: Ranya

texts.en:
Ranya is a 48-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi in Amman, Jordan. She has three children and requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for retailing in ladies’ and kids’ clothes. 

In the future, she would like to have her own shop. Ranya is looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in ladies' and kids' clothes.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Catherine has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells local drinks like "obushera". 

To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy millet flour to sell along with her drinks, and will help Catherine to generate greater profits. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her child. Catherine hopes that in the future she will be able to keep expanding her business. 

Catherine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy millet flour to sell

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Using her first loan has helped Maha a little bit in increasing her productivity, but she is still working on making more crafts using straw, hay, and some accessories. She has now applied for a new loan to bring in more raw material to make small decoration pieces to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy more materials

loans.name: Hector Colon

texts.es: Héctor tiene 61 años de edad estado civil casado  tiene 3 hijos desde pequeño siempre me gustaban los carros por eso desde que era muy joven trabaje como ayudante de mecánica. a Héctor le gustaba arreglara  carros ,por eso desde  hace 15 años atrás el se independizo y ahora tiene su taller de mecánica por ahora El trabaja solo ,pero cuando una toca hacer trabajos grandes contrato ayudantes. Ya que trabajo de 6.00am hasta 5:pm el anhelo es comprarme mas herramienta y contratar más personal para el taller Con el préstamo quiere comprar :más herramientas y también capitalizarlo para contratar ayudantes
texts.en:
Héctor, age 61, is single and has three children.  He has always liked cars, starting when he was little.  Therefore, ever since he was a very young man he worked as a mechanic’s assistant.  Héctor liked to fix cars, so he became independent 15 years ago.

He now has his own mechanic shop.  He works alone, but when he has big jobs he hires helpers.  He works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  He wishes to buy more tools and to hire more people for his shop.  He wants to use the loan to buy more tools and to have the money to hire helpers.

loans.use: to buy more tools and to hire helpers.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Annet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Annet has been working hard to manage her general shop, which sells sugar, rice, and posho (maize flour). 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soap, rice, and other commodities to sell, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and use the profits for school fees when her child starts school. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, and other commodities to sell.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
Ms. Sarwar is a 51-year-old active woman. She has been in the business of making fabric with her husband for the past eight years. When she started this business, her income was very low but with the passage of time her business income increased, which is only due to her passion to give a better future to her kids. She is illiterate, so she wants to see her children well educated. 

She has two machines. She now wants to purchase reels of cotton threads and bundles of wool in various colors for her business so that her family income will be increased, and she will be able to manage her family's financial matters better. 

For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs). Her loan has been approved by Kashf Foundation. She has already repaid five previous loans from Kashf Foundation. Sarwar wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To purchase reels of cotton threads and bundles of wool in various colors.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, já não frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 3 netos que vivem com ele.
É comerciante e dona do seu negocio. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, feijão, caldos, sabão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar a sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja apostar ainda mais no seu negócio e aumentar a renda mensal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é reforçar melhorar a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Florinda is married and the mother of 4 children who no longer attend School, lives in her own house with her family and supports 3 grandchildren who live with her.

She is a tradeswoman and owns her own business. With this loan she intends to buy products (rice, flour, beans, stocks, soup and others) to diversify and increase the quantity of her merchandise.

In future she wishes to bet even more on her business and increase her monthly income. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to further reinforce her commercial activities.

loans.use: buy products (rice, flour, beans, stocks, soup and others)

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr: Paulette est une femme de 29 ans,ccommerçante,mère de famille.Elle a ouvert et gère un bar près de son domicile dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 5 ans déjà.Son activité fonctionne normalement grâce à son accueil chaleureux et son expérience qui lui ont permis de conquérir une clientèle importante.Mais cependant,la croissance considérable de sa clientèle ne lui permet guère de satisfaire à la demande de celle-ci,ceci dû à la petitesse de son capital d'où l'importance de ce crédit en moment pour son activité,car il l'aidera à augmenter le nombre de casiers de boissons ce qui lui permetrra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle ,mais d'augmenter ses ventes et ses bénéfices.Elle réinvestira une partie de ces bénéfices dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Paulette is a 29-year-old merchant with children. She runs a bar that she opened 5 years ago near her home in a district of the capital. Her warmth and experience have helped her to build a solid customer base whose needs she can no longer meet due to a lack of funds. 

She is seeking a loan to increase her stock of beverages. This will help her not only to meet customer demand, but also to bolster her sales and profits. 

She will reinvest part of these profits in her activity, and use the remainder to provide for her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to bolster her stock of cases of beverages.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Jeneba from Moriba town in the Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 7 years and 24 years. Three children are currently attending school. 

In 2000, Jeneba established her food stand business within a busy market area. She began her business to raise income to support herself and her children's education. She works at the business six days per week and 12 hours a day. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run it.

The purpose of the loan is to buy more gallons of palm oil and more rice to increase her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, Jeneba plans to renovate her house's roof and expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil and more rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy products (oil, rice, flour, beans, stocks, soups and others) to diversify and increase the quantity of his goods

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 9 filhos, 2 ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele.
É pensionista militar e com este empréstimo pretende comprar uma cabeça de gado para abater e revender a carne. 
No futuro deseja ver seu negocio a prosperar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é reforçar melhorar a sua actividade comercial e pagar o empréstimo mais rápido possível.
texts.en:
Armando is married and the father of 9 children, 2 of whom are still in School. He lives in his own house with his family and supports 2 grandchildren who live with him.

He is a military pensioner and with this loan he intends to buy one head of cattle to put down and resell the meat.

In future he wishes to see his business prosper and to this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

His challenge is to reinforce his commercial activities and pay off this loan as quickly as possible.

loans.use: buy one head of cattle to resell as meat

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 57, is a married father of four. 

For 21 years, he has owned a construction supplies shop. His business is very remarkable and he has a broad experience in this field but he also needs to follow the updates in this sector. Just like his previous loan requests, Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for the eighth cycle to be invested in improving his business through increasing his merchandise. His previous loans all met with very impressive results.

Ali has improved his business gradually. With the increased merchandise, he was capable of increasing his income and targeting more construction workers with the special offers he provided.

He hopes to keep on expanding and improving his business capital to make sure that his family is satisfied with what he provides.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise to improve his business.

loans.name: Victoria Antonieta

texts.es: Victoria tiene 51 años de edad estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos Desde que era muy joven  su madre le enseño lo que la confección de ropa eso a ella le encanto por lo que ahora ese es su  trabajo ella tiene una maquina en su casa, la cual elabora camisas, pantalones. Por eso con el préstamo ella quiere comprar cosas como: hilo ,tela y otra máquina de coser
texts.en:
Victoria, age 51, is single and does not have children.  When she was very young, her mother taught her how to make clothes.  Victoria loved it, and this is now her work.  She has a machine in her house, which she uses to make shirts and pants.

Therefore, with this loan she wants to buy things like thread, fabric, and another sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es: Ángela tiene 44 años  estado civil casada. Cuenta ella que para apoyar a su esposo se puso un negocio de ventas de almuerzos ya que le esta resultado buen negocio contratar  a unos ayudantes. El horario de ella en que labora es  de 6:00am hasta 6:PM .Lo que desea ella es agrandar su negocio y no solo vender almuerzos sino también vender merienda todos los días y que ese sueño se convierta en gran restaurante .  Con el prestamos comprara: arroz, aceite , platos , etc.
texts.en:
Ángela is 44 years old and married.  She says that in order to help her husband, she set up a business of selling lunches.  This has turned into a good business, and she employs some helpers.  Her works schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.

What she wishes for is to expand her business and to not just sell lunches.  She also wants to sell snacks every day because her dream is to become a big restaurant.

She will use the loan to buy rice, cooking oil, and plates, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, and plates, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es: Manuel tiene 28 años de edad estado civil soltero, tiene 1 hija. El comenzó trabajando en una panadería de unos tíos en la actualidad el tiene su propia panadería la cual es su fuente de dinero en la actualidad. Su anhelo es comprarse un horno para así poder seguir creciendo en su panadería. Con el préstamo él quiere comprar:harina, mantequilla, 1 horno
texts.en:
Manuel, age 28, is single and has a daughter.  He started working in his aunt’s and uncle’s bakery.  He now has his own bakery, which is his current source of income.

He wants to buy an oven in order to be able to continue growing in his bakery.  He wants to use the loan to buy flour, butter, and an oven.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, and an oven.

loans.name: Rasmeyeh

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Rasmeyeh prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Rasmeyeh is a 51-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi in Amman, Jordan. She has no children. She has requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on staples such as rice, soap, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Dorah is quite the businesswoman and sells vegetables and charcoal and also has a pig-rearing business. 

To help expand her business, Dorah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and matoke (steamed green bananas) to sell, and will help Dorah to generate greater profits and allow her to live more comfortably. Dorah hopes that in the future she will be able to increase profits after expanding her business. 

Dorah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and matoke (steamed green bananas) to sell

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es: Luis tiene 55 años de edad, estado civil casado. Don Luis nos comenta que comenzó ya hace 30 años con el dinero que tenia ahorrado se compro una carreta de refresco la cual ese hoy en día es su trabajo, la ventas de refresco como a tenido una buena acogida por todo los habitantes de playas él quiere seguir con su negocio pues para El es muy rentable El se levanta a las 6:00am,  y va a comprar  hielo y las esencias para poder salir a comercializar sus refrescos. Su sueño es de seguir construyendo su vivienda que ya con tanto esfuerzo la está terminando de construir. Con el préstamo el va a comprar cosas para construir su casa, y también para su negocio: arena, piedra, cemento , para el negocio hielos, esencias etc.
texts.en:
Luis is 55 years old, and he is married.  Luis tells us that he started 30 years ago with the money he had saved.  He bought a cold drink cart, which he still uses in his work today. 

Because his cold drink sales have been well received by all of the beach dwellers, he wants to continue with his business.  It is very profitable for him.  

He gets up at 6:00 a.m. and goes to buy ice and the flavoring in order to be able to go out and sell his cold drinks.  

His dream is to continue building his house because, with so much effort, he is finishing construction.

He will use the loan to buy things to build his house and things for his business.  He will buy sand, rocks, and cement.  For his business he will buy ice and flavoring, etc.

loans.use: to buy sand, rocks, and cement for building and to buy ice and flavoring, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Augusta from Moriba in the southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of 11 years and 13 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2005, Augusta established her palm oil business. 

She began her business because she did not go school. Her parents ran this type business, so she learned from them. She works every day, 12 hour per day. She says that her main challenge is transportation from the village to town because the road network is very poor.

Augusta requires a loan to buy more palm oil and groundnuts. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Augusta hopes to build a big store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil and groundnuts.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past three years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and a good client list. Her formal education is graduation. Her husband is an auto rickshaw driver, whose income is not sufficient to support his family alone. 

She is the mother of a baby. She lives in a large family of eight members. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 1st loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Oumarou

texts.fr: Oumarou est une femme de 33 ans mariée, mère de familles. Ele est commerçante dans un marché de la place où elle vend des vivres frais et secs selon les saisons et aussi des poissons fumés  depuis 12 ans déjà. cette activité fonctionne à merveille c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter en grandes quantité ses poissons fumés (deux cartons) ce qui permettra d'augmenter de fonds de commerce, d'éviter les ruptures de stocks qu'elle rencontre souvent et surtout de réaliser un plus gros bénéfice. Profit qui sera en partie  économiser pour la scolarité de ses enfants, de subvenir aux besoins quotidien de sa famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Oumarou is a 33-year-old, married woman and a mother of a family. 

She is a merchant in a local market where she has been selling fresh and dried food according to the seasons and also smoked fish for 12 years already. 

This business does well. It's for this that she is asking for a loan to buy a large quantity of smoked fish (2 cartons). This loan will allow [her] to increase her business, avoid shortages in stock--which she often encounters--and above all earn a higher income. 

Some of the profits will be saved for her children's schooling and to serve the everyday needs of her family. The rest will be reinvested to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of smoked fish

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora Nicolasa tiene 47 años de edad tiene 5 hijos, se caso muy joven, trabajo mas de 10 años como comerciante en el mercado de verduras para poder dar alimento a sus niños, con la pareja que estaba ese tiempo no había mucho entendimiento, por esta razón ella trabajaba sola para el sustento de sus hijos, después de muchos años de esfuerzo por fin 3 de sus hijos crecieron, ella se divorcio, decidió dejar el comercio de verduras por problemas de salud, se quedo con dos de sus hijos que aun necesitaban su apoyo, sin embargo después de 5 años de separación conoció a su actual pareja que también es separado, tienen 3 dependientes, al ver las necesidades de su familia doña Nicolasa decidió comprar un kiosco en el mercado de verduras en donde vende jugos, refrescos, pastillas y otro tipo de productos de consumo de la zona, para poder mejorar los ingresos por la gran demanda decidieron realizar una inversión mas amplia en los producto del kiosco.
texts.en: Nicolasa, 47, has five children.  She married very young and worked for more than ten years as a merchant in the vegetable market in order to feed her children.  The relationship between her and her spouse at the time wasn’t very good which is why she worked by herself to support her children.  After many years of effort three of her children had grown up and she got divorced.  She decided to leave the vegetable business because of health reasons but still had two children that needed her support.  However, five years after her separation, she met her current spouse who is also separated and the two of them have three dependents.  Seeing her family’s needs, Nicolasa decided to buy a kiosk in the vegetable market where she sells juice, refreshments, pills and other types of local consumer goods  to improve income.  Because of the great demand they decided to invest in a wider selection of goods for the kiosk.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María es una persona que siempre le ha gustado trabajar arduamente para salir adelante, ella vive junto a sus dos hijos por quienes ha luchado mucho para darles lo mejor. María posee una pupusería la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación donde las elabora y comercializa. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: harina de arroz, maíz, chicharrón, tomates, repollos, vinagre y otros ingredientes más para realizar las pupusas. María lo que desea es aumentar sus ventas para poder vivir de forma estable.
texts.en:
María is a person that has always liked to work hard in order to progress. She lives together with her two children, for whom she has struggled a lot in order to give them the best. María owns a pupusería [place where pupusas are made and/or sold]. She prepares them and sells them at home.

María is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL, in order to be able to buy a greater quantity of raw material, such as rice flour, corn, pork meat, tomatos, cabbages, vinegar and other ingredients for preparing the pupusas.

María hopes to increase her sales and to be able to have a stable life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pupusas [thick, stuffed corn tortillas].

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es: Pablo tiene 37 años estado civil casado tiene 2 hijo que estudian en la escuela todo empieza cuan Pablo desde muy joven le atraía la que es las artesanía por eso hace unos 20 años atrás con su liquidación del último estable que tuvo se puso su negocio propio la cual era todo lo referente a la artesanías poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo gracias a los turista que van y le compran las artesanías hechas por el mismo  su esposa es la que lo ayuda en el negocio. El comienza su trabajo de 8:00am hasta las 5:00pm también la actualidad está comenzando vendar ropa también pues lo que el quiere es que su negocio este bien surtido . Pablo dice que quiere seguir ampliando su negocio mas y mas . Con el préstamo va a comprar mas: artesanías , taguas , ropas etc.
texts.en: Pablo is 37 years old, is married and has 2 children that study in school. It all began when Pablo was very young he was drawn to the craft. 20 years ago, after the liquidation of his last stand that he had, he started his own business which was all about crafts. Little by little his business has been growing thanks to the tourists that come and buy the handicrafts made by himself and his wife who helps with his business. He starts work at 8:00 am and works until 5:00 pm. Also today his is beginning to sell clothes because he wants his business to be well stocked. Pablo says that he wants to continue growing his business more and more. With the loan he is going to buy more handicrafts, taguas (nuts that can be carved into handicrafts), clothes, etc.

loans.use: to buy more: crafts, taguas (nuts that can be carved into handicrafts), clothes, etc.

loans.name: Helmi

texts.en:
Helmi is a 48-year-old married man who is the father of three children. For the past 22 years, he has been selling shoes and he opened his own shop in 1998. Helmi is a man with a very good reputation in his region as a hard worker and a trustful person. 

Helmi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for his child's university fees. He has had three previous loans with Al Majmoua and he used his loans to invest in improving and increasing his business capital. Helmi is very impressed with the results he obtained with his loans and he is especially excited about this one as it will help him achieve one of his biggest personal goals which is to provide the best education for his children. Helmi hopes to continue improving his business to provide his family with financial support.

loans.use: to pay his child's university fees

loans.name: Elsy Alicia

texts.es: Elsi Alicia de sesenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de chuco y además para complementar los gastos del hogar cultiva maíz y frijol, tiene varios años en el negocio  y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el  terreno donde cultiva esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los precios accesibles y además por el servicio inigualable; Elsi es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan avanzar en el camino al éxito, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo muchas perdidas y desea recuperarse pero para ello necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, abono, etc. Elsi tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elsi Alicia, 62, lives with her son.  She earns a living selling chuco and supplements her income with a farming business.  She has grown and harvested maize and beans for several years now and has learned what it takes to ensure a good crop.  She lives in a farming region and her land is close to her house.  She sells her crop locally and says that demand for her crop is good because she supplies an excellent product at a fair price.  Elsi is an enterprising and tenacious woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She is applying for an INTEGRAL loan that she will use to buy supplies--seeds, insecticides, fertilizer, etc.--for her farming business.  She says that she has to make up for losses that she incurred during the last growing season.  Elsi has good references and is confident that she can repay the loan.  She says that the investment will make it possible for her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy suppplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plants.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Marie from Moriba town in the southern area in Bo. She is single with three children between the ages of three and eight. One of her children is currently attending school. For the past four years, Marie has been running a food stand in a busy market area where she sells onions, Maggie, salt, and cooking seasonings. Marie works 12 hours every day and her business is her only income. Her biggest business challenge is the lack of capital. 

Marie is requesting a loan to buy more onions, Maggie, salt, and cooking seasonings. The extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her living standards. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business and build a house for her family. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more onions, Maggie, salt, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 42-year-old married man with four children. He is from Al Baqaa, Jordan. He works in a beauty salon and has over 20 years of experience. He started his business with 3,000 JOD and now his goods are worth 10,000 JOD.

Fouad is requesting an 1,800 JOD loan to pay for redecorating his beauty salon and to buy cosmetics to sell. In the future, he would like to become a tutor for new cosmetology graduates. Fouad also would like to buy a house.

loans.use: to redecorate his beauty salon and buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Sulma Yesenia

texts.es: Sulma Yesenia de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto a su  compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella  posee un comedor donde vende variedad de comida, sopas, carnes, arroz, ensaladas, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio por lo que adquirió gran experiencia en la cocina que le permite preparar los platillos mas exquisitos, esta ubicada en un lugar muy estratégico y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es elaborado con material de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; Sulma es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante todos los días se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que solo abriendo caminos alcanzara el éxito, en las ultimas semanas en su negocio aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permite comprar carnes, verduras, granos básicos, bebidas, etc. Sulma Yesenia tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Sulma Yesenia is 31 years old and lives with her companion and their children.  

She sells a variety of food, soups, meats, rice, salads, etc. from her dining room.  The many years she has been running this business have provided her with a lot of experience in the kitchen, which allows her to prepare the most exquisite meals.  Her business is located in a very strategic location where she has a good number of customers, who prefer her food because it is made with the highest-quality ingredients and the prices are reasonable.  She also provides good service.  

Sulma is an entrepreneurial woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She puts out the maximum effort every day since she knows that only by going after opportunities will she succeed.

In recent weeks, the demand for her business has increased and she would like to take advantage of this by making another investment.  In order to do this, whe will need the capital, which she has requested from INTEGRAL to buy meats, vegetables, grains, beverages, etc.  Sulma Yesenia has good references for payment and is very responsible.  She assures that she will be able to pay off her debt and at the same time she has faith that she will be able to lift her family to financial security.

loans.use: to buy meats, vegetables, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: El Sr. Carmelo tiene 37 años y es casado con 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el Sr. Carmelo tiene la actividad de cerrajería desde hace ya mucho tiempo, su taller se encuentra en la zona Italia,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Carmelo va a usar este préstamo  para compra de materiales para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo y la  necesidad  que tiene de ampliar su negocio, mejorar   y así de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes, El Sr. Carmelo  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia, ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Mr. Carmelo is 37 years old. He is married and has three children who attend school. Mr. Carmelo has worked with metals for a long time. His workshop is located in the Italia area.

This loan is his first cycle in the institution. Mr. Carmelo will use this loan to buy materials for his business. He is requesting this money because he is lacking cash and because he needs to expand his business, to improve, and in this way satisfy his clients.

Mr. Carmelo faces challenges in his business, like increasing his clients and he will use the benefits to improve his family's quality of life, because this is the only activity that allows him to support himself.

loans.use: to buy materials for his business.

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer is a 39-year-old woman who has three sons and one daughter, all of whom are under 18 years old. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo standing next to his gas canisters. For the past three years, Tahreer's husband has distributed and sold these canisters to customers and institutions. His business has been profitable and is the only source of income for the family. He has a good reputation and has many loyal customers.

Tahreer is requesting a loan through Faten to help her husband purchase additional gas canisters to meet customer demand. Her loan will help contribute to her husband's income and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Tahreer's husband looks forward to having  his own gas station to distribute gas to the region where he lives.

loans.use: to purchase gas canisters to sell and distribute to customers

loans.name: Melba

texts.es: Melba, tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos quienes están casados, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Doña melva toda su vida ha trabajado para darle manutención a su familia, lleva 20 años de dedicarse a elaborar y vender pan casero como ser: semitas, quesadilla con queso, rosquillas y tostacas. Ella desde muy temprano prepara sus productos y su horno de tierra. Los clientes son de su misma Colonia.  Ya ha  sido cliente de ODEF con varios prestamos, actualmente solicito un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos que necesita en su panadería como harina, levadura, huevos, azúcar, manteca, leche, queso, etc. para ella los prestamos le ayudan a comprar los insumos de contado a los proveedores y por mayor para obtener mejor ganancias. Su sueño es continuar con el negocio hasta tener un buen ahorro para su vejez.
texts.en:
Melba, 58, is a single mother; she has four married children.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  Melba has spent her entire life working to support her family.  She’s been working for 20 years making home-baked bread to sell: semitas [rolls], quesadilla con queso [cheese-filled rolls], rosquillas [ring-shaped, crunchy cookies] and tostacas [wafer of the rosquilla dough with a circle of pure sugar cane spread or sprinkled on top before it is finished baking].  

She makes her goods very early in an earthen oven and her customers are from her same neighborhood.  She’s been an ODEF client for several loans already and is currently requesting one for 7,000 Lempiras to buy ingredients like flour, yeast, eggs, sugar, shortening, milk, cheese, etc. for her bakery.  

The loans help her pay cash to her suppliers for her ingredients and to buy at wholesale thus obtaining higher profits.  Her dream is to stay in business until she has enough saved up for her old-age.

loans.use: to buy bread-baking ingredients.

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es: Freddy Daniel de 54 anos de edad, casado con tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente, Freddy es originario del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Chinandega de caracteriza por ser una zona comercial productiva. Freddy tiene por actividad económica la el servicio de taller de soldadura, tiempo de tener el negocio 45 anos, y lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Freddy trabaja con clientes fijos y eventuales  su rutina diaria es levantarse temprano y  abrir sus puertas al publico 8 horas diario para realizar todo trabajo de soldadura. Oficio que lo aprendió desde muy joven a la par de su padre quien trabajaba en lo mismo. En la actualidad ha podido poner su propio taller gracias a su esfuerzo y ganas de trabajar y tener un medio para mantener a su familia. Aunque hoy en día su carga familiar es menos pesada porque sus hijos todos trabajan. El financiamiento lo necesita para poder invertir al negocio y comprar un soldador para brindar mejor servicio a su clientela. Freddy  ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y cumplida con sus pagos. El agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en:
Freddy Daniel is 54 years old and married with three adult children, who all live on their own. Freddy is originally from the department of Chinandega, which is located in the western region of the country. Chinandega is known for being a productive commercial area. 

Freddy's business is a welding shop. He has been in business for 45 years, and has it set up in his home. Freddy works with both regular and occasional customers. His daily routine is getting up early to open the doors to the public eight hours a day for all kinds of welding jobs. He learned the trade when he was very young by working alongside his father, who was also a welder. He was able to set up his own shop thanks to his effort and eagerness to work so that he could have the means to support his family, even though currently he has a lighter load to carry since all of his children are working. 

He needs this financing to invest in his business and purchase a welder so that he can offer his customers better service. Freddy has worked with Fundación León 2000 in the past and has proven himself to be a responsible person and a reliable borrower. He appreciates the help that Kiva investors offer people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in his business by purchasing a welder for his shop.

loans.name: Santa Terecita Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento SANTA TERECITA está compuesta por nueve integrantes de los cuales cinco son mujeres y cuatro varones  que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra.
